topic.title: Index filesystem structure
topic.shortdesc: A description of the index filesystem structure.

body.p: Any index file has the form <type>_<hexadecimal_signature>.view.N Each component’s meaning is:

li.p: type - the index type, can be main (active vBuckets data) or replica (replica vBuckets data)

hexadecimal_signature - this is the hexadecimal form of an MD5 hash computed over the map/reduce functions of a design document, when these functions change, a new index is created. It’s possible to have multiple versions of the same design document alive (different signatures). This happens for a short period, for example when a client sends a stale=false request to an index (1 index == 1 design document). Such request triggers an index build/update, and before this update/build is finished the design document is updated with different map/reduce functions. The initial version of the index remains alive until all currently blocked clients on it are served. In the meanwhile, the new query requests are always redirected to the latest (second) version of the index, making it possible to have multiple versions of the same design document index files at any point in time even for short periods of time.

N - when an index file is created N is 1, always. Every time the index file is compacted, N is incremented by 1. This is similar to what happens for vBucket database files Data missing in query response or it’s wrong (potentially due to server issues)).

body.p: For each design document, there is also a subdirectory named like tmp_<hexadecimal_signature>_<type>. This directory contains temporary files used for the initial index build (and soon for incremental optimizations). Files within this directory have a name formed by the design document signature and a generated UUID. These files are periodically deleted when they are no more useful.

All views defined within a design document are backed by a tree data structure, and they all live inside the same index file. Therefore for each design document, independently of the number of views it defines, there are two files: one for main data and the other for replica data.
